availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William M. Edrington (Taylor County farmer and slaveholder)

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah F. Edrington. Father of Mary J., Sarah E., William T., Susan C., Eliza J., Margaret J., George A., Dora B., Robert W., and Lou Emma Edrington. Farmer in Taylor County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Taylor County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned eight enslaved people in Taylor County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor, Division 1, 187A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 33.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Division 2, p. 5.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor, Ireland, p. 249B.
Find A Grave, "William M. Edrington (1807-1868)," Memorial #104550636, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/104550636 (accessed October 1, 2019).
